ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '14'
libblas:
- 3.9.* *netlib
liblapack:
- 3.9.* *netlib
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - fortran_compiler_version

about.description:
The software ATOMPAW generates projector and basis functions which
are needed for performing electronic structure calculations
(Density-Functional Theory) based on the Projector Augmented Wave (PAW)
method.
about.summary: The software ATOMPAW generates projector and basis functions

about.description:
The software ATOMPAW generates projector and basis functions which
are needed for performing electronic structure calculations
(Density-Functional Theory) based on the Projector Augmented Wave (PAW)
method.
about.summary: The software ATOMPAW generates projector and basis functions

name: atompaw
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "atompaw" %}
{% set version = "4.2.0.5" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: http://users.wfu.edu/natalie/papers/pwpaw/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 45c66e02629252ba1065aa245a277af9528ed5d560c2f11979452a7ec6e99ac8

build:
  number: 0
  skip: true  # [not linux]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}
    - make
    - automake
    - autoconf
    - libtool
  host:
    - libblas
    - liblapack
    - libxc <5.0

test:
  commands:
    - atompaw --help

about:
  home: http://users.wfu.edu/natalie/papers/pwpaw/man.html
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: COPYING
  summary: The software ATOMPAW generates projector and basis functions

  description: |
    The software ATOMPAW generates projector and basis functions which 
    are needed for performing electronic structure calculations 
    (Density-Functional Theory) based on the Projector Augmented Wave (PAW) 
    method.
  doc_url: http://users.wfu.edu/natalie/papers/pwpaw/man.html
  dev_url: https://github.com/atompaw/atompaw

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jan-janssen
